description: From lady +‎ bird, the “lady” here referring to the Virgin Mary, Jesus’ mother. Compare German Marienkäfer (literally “Mary beetle/bug”).

entries.meaning: Any of the Coccinellidae family of beetles, typically having a round shape and red or yellow spotted elytra.
examples: Synonyms: (North America) ladybug, (preferred by some scientists) lady beetle, (obsolete, Britain) ladycow, (obsolete, Britain) lady fly, (archaic, dialectal UK) bishy barnabee
